resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Update read receipt indicator icon across Virtru properties

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
As a person using Read Receipt, I expect the indicator to reflect whether or not the direct recipients of the message have read it. I also care about how many people the message has been forwarded to, but that should be reflected separately.

*Acceptance Criteria*
* Read Receipt math is calculated using only the direct recipients of a message
* BP and DSH display the same RR status
fields.summary: Read Receipt indicator applies to direct recipients

comments.body:
Implementation:
Remove fwdLog recipients from recipients read rate math in the policy search document. Confirm that read receipt calculating logic is entirely in design doc and not in component used by BP/DSH.

Lost some time debugging why Cloudant was not showing the same output that the Chrome debugger was. Appears that updating an array while iterating over it will work in Chrome. Will not work in Cloudant.
The forwarding tree in dashboard, shows messages that were forwarded to be open, but not green.  See screenshot.
[~dcrowley], This is related to WS-3595, rather than WS-3531. Can you re-close this and re-open the other?
The forwarding tree in dashboard, shows messages that were forwarded to be open, but not green. See screenshot.

http://screencast.com/t/ba6p08H81d  - the dashboard should only show 33% because only 1 of 3 direct recipients read the email.

Read Receipt is counting the people it was forwarded to as being part of the Read Receipt calculation.  The Browser Extension is correct, but the dashboard is not.  We also don't want to show the read receipt icon next to recipients the emails were forwarded to.
The tool tips should NOT be showing %s either. The numbering convention used should be identical to the one used in BP. So it should show "1 of 3" vs "33%".
This issue may have been erroneously reopened. Confirmation required.
The BP build attached is for confirmation that the fwd icon is still present after moving the read receipt dependencies into their own repo. It should not show any functional changes.
This is close, the envelope icons need to be removed for anyone it was forwarded to.  The envelope icon should only show for direct recipients.  So the second level should not have envelope icons.

Wait - I think this may be right. In the BP interface, the count of "reads" should be of the direct recipients. There should be a different indicator that shows the number of times it was forwarded. However, once in the dashboard view, looking at the forwarding tree, I think it IS appropriate to show the envelop icon next to each recipient. The tool tip should not pop up, and the text to the right of it should be when it was read. [~raymond] what's your take?

[~jordan] the envelope icons don't actually work, it will always say unread.  So if we keep it, it needs to work.  So either way works for me, but right now the icons show and always say unread even if its read.
Ahhhhh, yeah that's a problem. [~jason] What is the LOE on getting the icon's to accurately reflect "read" status?

Low. I'm surprised it isn't working because I definitely tested it, to the extent that I wrote automated tests for it as well. Dan, can you provide a screencap of where it isn't working? It sounds like I'll need to update the tests as well.
here it is - as you can see the email was forwarded twice, and both email addresses that forwarded is shown as unread.  http://screencast.com/t/P5oi2g5W - and it had to be read to be forwarded.

Sorry for chiming in late here. Basically, +1 to everything Jordan said. 

Just wanted to clarify the definition "# of times forwarded" so we are all on the same page. Dan had pointed out that you could forward 1 time to five recipients. IMO, times = recipients that received a forward. 

From a user's perspective, its more valuable to know how many recipients received a forward than simply the number of times. Furthermore, I believe that most users interpret forwarding as the number of recipients rather than the action of forwarding. For example, you would say "I forwarded the email to 5 people" rather than, "I forwarded the email once to 5 people." (Although, I have no data to support this theory). It might be more accurate to say *"# of recipients forwarded to."* Only case where this could get confusing is forwarding to group emails, where we do not know the total number of recipients.
To work you have to expand the email to show the whole thread.  Which makes sense because that is the actual email that was sent.
